metadata.title: CVE-2016-1665 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The JSGenericLowering class in compiler/js-generic-lowering.cc in GoogleV8, as used in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.94, mishandles comparisonoperators, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive informationvia crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
